metadata.title: CVE-2022-32208 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When curl < 7.84.0 does FTP transfers secured by krb5, it handles messageverification failures wrongly. This flaw makes it possible for aMan-In-The-Middle attack to go unnoticed and even allows it to inject datato the client.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.12
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.12
libcurl3-nss - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.12
libcurl4 - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.68.0-1ubuntu2.12').
